menus.description: Rice made with tomatoes, onions, scotch bonnets, and chili peppers. There are endless variations on this recipe, but those five ingredients are usual constants.
Light and spicy soup traditionally made with goat meat, but often with fish or other meat, as well as herbs and Nigerian spices.
A stew usually made with crayfish or other meat and thickened with ground melon seeds(egusi).
A rich spinach stew usually made with spinach, scotch bonnets, and red bell peppers.
Fried bean cakes.Usually served as a breakfast food or snack and made with black eyed peas, these fritters are crunchy, spicy, and perfect alone or with a dipping sauce.
Deep fried plantain slices.
Deep fried dough, served plain or with powdered sugar.
Mashed steamed beans with pepper sauce.
A tomato - based beef stew served with rice or starchy vegetables.
Grilled beef skewers seasoned with spicy peanut mix.
Soup made with okra, spinach, and crayfish.
What is it ? A stew made with spicy scotch bonnets, smoked dried shrimp, and iru(also known as locust beans or dawa dawa).
Roasted plantain.Literally all you need to prepare this popular street food and snack are plantains, salt, and peanuts.Boli can also be enjoyed with grilled fish or pepper sauce.
A steamed bean cake made with blended black eyed peas, flaked fish, and often hard boiled eggs.
Jollof rice is unarguably the most popular Nigerian food. Folks that are just starting with Nigerian cooking are advised to start with jollof rice.
Nigerian swallows include eba, fufu, Semo, pounded yam, tuwo shinkafa and quite a few others. In Nigeria, we serve swallow and soups as dinner or lunch.
Yams are generally prepared in different ways in Nigeria. Porridge yam is like the number one way to eat yam in Nigeria. It is major staple food in Nigeria.

Porridge beans is a popular Nigerian food. There is hardly any reputable eateries or restaurant in Nigerian that doesn’t serve cooked beans. You could make beans and yam porridge combo, or boil plain white beans and serve with stew.
Tea and bread is a popular delicious breakfast from Nigeria. Lots of Nigerians eat this for breakfast. Often, it is combined with fried eggs.
Noodle is food to millions of Nigerians, especially kids and young adults. Millions of tonnes of noodles are consumed monthly in Nigerian universities.

Spaghetti is a popular Nigerian food, It doesn’t stay much in the pot when I prepare it this way. My kids love spaghetti this way, their dad too. You could also boil spaghetti and serve with stew or sauce.
Unripe plantain porridge is food to millions of Nigerians. I make this at least once every week in my home.

Porridge beans is a popular Nigerian food. There is hardly any reputable eateries or restaurant in Nigerian that doesn’t serve cooked beans. You could make beans and yam porridge combo, or boil plain white beans and serve with stew.
Tea and bread is a popular delicious breakfast from Nigeria. Lots of Nigerians eat this for breakfast. Often, it is combined with fried eggs.
Unripe plantain porridge is food to millions of Nigerians. I make this at least once every week in my home.
We eat lots of rice in Nigeria. There are over 20 different rice recipes from Nigeria. This is one of them. The vegetable sauce is made separately and then served with boiled white rice.

I like to combine agidi and cooked beans and then serve with stew as you can see above. Agidi (eko) is food for the Yorubas, other ethnic groups in Nigeria also have a way of making this.

Spaghetti is a popular Nigerian food, It doesn’t stay much in the pot when I prepare it this way. My kids love spaghetti this way, their dad too. You could also boil spaghetti and serve with stew or sauce.
Pepper soup is a popular food in Nigeria. it is served as a side dish or combined with yam and served as lunch or dinner.
Bread could be store-bought or homemade, the point is that we eat lots of bread in Nigeria. It is eaten as a snack, Nigerian food, or paired with tea and served as breakfast.
Suya is made from beef or chicken. I have also seen fish suya and some other recipes. We eat lots of suya in Nigeria. Usually as a snack or side dish.

Yamarita is food to millions of Nigerians. It is a very popular Hausa food. Unlike several other foods that take several hours to prepare, this Nigerian food could be made in just few minutes. It is just egg-coated yams that undergo the process of frying.

A combination of rice and tomato stew is a popular Nigerian food. It is served exactly the way you see above. Most times the stew is poured on top of the rice instead of being on a separate plate.

African salad is a popular Igbo food. The main ingredient is cassava flakes. The rest is palm oil, peppers, etc.

Ogbono soup is certainly the second most popular soup in Nigeria. There is hardly any eatry or restaurant in Nigeria that doesn’t serve ogbono soup. Ogbono soup can be served with either eba, fufu or semo.
